reviews.text: I've lived here for 2 nights at room 529 on August 2007. The location was the reason I've chose it, and unfortunatly that's the only thing I love about it at last.
reviews.title: alright

likes.liked: — location location since south bank is a good area
likes.disliked: — staff at front desk, the design of the hall way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at front dest were not friendly when checking in/ while talking and couldn't really remember the thing I've asked for- just to move my twin beds together so I could stay in one bed by myself (and i've booked a double/king bed at first, but they insist that's the only room they got for me)- I've asked for moving the bed twice after 4 hours I've made the first request. The first impression of the room was quite uncomfortable. It was noon and the curtain was close, the room was complete dark when arrived. The smell was not really good it smells like the room havnt been used for a long time. The water boiler at mini bar covered with dust. Exclude all these, the room was spacious and all the duvet and other things are just fine. The concierge were really friendly and helpful, with the great location at south bank, that's the only things I like about this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location--south bank park is gorgeous!

likes.liked: — Location and service--and lovely, unique, nicely heated pool!

reviews.text: Hubby and I stayed here for two nights in June (also stayed at the Stamford Plaza and the Royal Albert in Brisbane--we were rate and location hopping). Tripadvisor helped sooo much with planning this 2-week trip around Queensland. We found the best rate going to the Saville's website, surprisingly.
reviews.title: Good option for conference visitors

likes.liked: — Proximity to convention centre and restaurants; cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a really nice hotel with extremely friendly, helpful staff (though I must say, everyone in Aus was super-happy!) We got in at 9 am Aus time (11 pm US time, after traveling for 24 hours) and they had a room ready for us (I had emailed them in advance letting them know we'd be arriving then, and would be exhausted: they'd offered showers but no promises about the room being ready) so we were soooo grateful!
reviews.title: The place to stay if you're in South Bank
Great Bedroom Apartment
reviews.text: Also, we rented bikes at the botanical gardens and biked all around the paths that line the river banks--it was beautiful, and an easy ride. The rental was for overnight, and the hotel let us wheel the bikes right through the lobby (we asked before bringing the muddy things in) and put them in storage for us with a smile!

This place is perfect for all types - expecially business travellers prolonging their stay for lesiure. The suites are spacious and stylish, the restaurant downstairs is the pick of the area. The rest of Southbank Restaurants are very hit and miss - we struck out twice in two attempts. Don't go to the Turkish Ahmet or the Cafe Toscanis.
reviews.title: Great Place

likes.liked: — Positioning and big rooms with all necessary faciltiies

reviews.text: Well positioned, helpfiul staff and good space suites.
reviews.title: Excellent Accomodation

likes.liked: — The size of the rooms & the cleanliness

reviews.text: Our room was a superior one bedroomed apartment, it was fully equipped & maintained to the highest level.
reviews.title: What a Great Hotel
Love this Hotel
reviews.text: The staff were friendly & most helpful & the location of the premises was just perfect & far enough away from Brisbane City, but easy to get to.
We did not use the facilities at the apartments as there are plenty of restaurants & shops very close by.
reviews.title: A good stay..the staff only shine half the time
